chapter.title: Working With Jobs
chapter.para: The Jobs view displays jobs, which were imported and processed by &dbpi;. The following actions are supported in the Jobs view:

sect1.title: Importing a Job
sect1.para: You can import a new job as a predefined JSON file.
Proceed as follows to import a new job.

step.para: Switch to the Jobs view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Import
(Import).
Click the Select File button next to the Documents field.
In the file selection dialog, select an input file for which you want to create the new job from the directory tree.
In the file selection dialog, click Open to confirm the selection and close the dialog.
Click the Select File button next to the Metadata field.
In the file selection dialog, select a JSON file containing the metadata for the new job from the directory tree.
In the file selection dialog, click Open to confirm the selection and close the dialog.
Click OK to confirm the selected files.

result.para: If the two selected files are valid, the imported job will be displayed in the overview table in the Jobs view.
If the JSON file does not have the expected structure, the import will be terminated with an error message.

sect1.title: Listing Jobs
sect1.para: You can display an overview of the imported and processed jobs in the Jobs view.
The overview table displays the following information for each process by default:

listitem.para: The unique identifier of the job
The job class ID (e.g. PRINTED)
Number of pages in job.
Number of sheets in job.
Number of documents in a job
Creation date and time of the job.
Additional job information. This can be a brief description or remarks about the job.

sect1.title: Displaying Job Details
sect1.para: You can display the details for a specific job in the details pane. Compared to the overview table, the details pane contains more information about the selected job.
The following information is available in the details pane of a selected job:

listitem.para: The unique identifier of the job
The job class ID (e.g. PRINTED)
Job subclass. This information has the following structure: [CHANNEL]_[SUBCHANNEL].
Additional job information.
Number of pages in job.
Number of sheets in job.
Number of documents in job.
Creation date and time of the job.
Additional job information.
Number of documents of type Physical Inserts in the job.
Number of documents of type Electronic Inserts in the job.
Number of documents of type Cover Sheet in the job.
Number of sheets of type Electronic Inserts in the job.
Number of sheets of type Cover Sheet in the job.
Number of sheets of type Start/End Sheet in the job.
Number of sheets of type Separator Sheet in the job.

sect1.title: Filtering Jobs
sect1.para: Use this action to filter the overview of available jobs by ID.
Proceed as follows to filter the existing jobs and thus reduce the number of displayed jobs.

step.para: Switch to the Jobs view.
In the navigation bar of the view, place the cursor in the text field Filter.
You can filter the existing jobs by ID (simple filter) or by other parameters (for more information about filter criteria, see ).

sect1.title: Editing a Job
sect1.para: Use this action to change the configuration settings of an existing job.
Proceed as follows to edit the properties of a job.

step.para: Switch to the Jobs view.
Select a job from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Icon Edit
(Edit).

result.para: The selected entry in the overview table changes to editing mode.

step.para: In the Class field, enter the desired new job class.
In the Comment field, enter the desired text as required.
In the PU_SPOOL_HANDLER_ID field, specify the job user properties (handler ID) as required.

Click Save button
(Save) to save the changes in the job configuration and exit the editing mode for the selected entry.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the changes are displayed in the overview table and in the detail pane of the selected entry.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel the changes and exit the editing mode without saving the changes.

sect1.title: Editing Multiple Jobs
sect1.para: You can edit selected values for multiple jobs in one step.

note.para: Please keep in mind that with this function, you define the same values for all selected jobs.

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the settings of the selected jobs.

step.para: Switch to the Jobs view.
Select at least two jobs from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Icon Edit
(Edit).
Tick the checkbox in front of each value you want to change for all selected jobs.
In the Class field, specify the desired new job class for all selected jobs, if required.
In the Subclass field, specify the desired new subclass for all selected jobs, if required.
In the Information field, specify the desired values for all selected jobs, if required.
In the Comment field, enter the desired text as required.
In the PU_SPOOL_HANDLER_ID field, specify the job user properties (handler ID) for all selected jobs, if required.
Click OK to save the changed settings for all selected jobs and close the dialog.

result.para: The changed settings for all selected jobs are displayed in the overview table and in the details pane.

step.para: Click Cancel to close the dialog without changing the settings.

sect1.title: Unbundling Jobs
sect1.para: Use this action to unzip an existing job package. This action is useful if, for example, you want to assign new envelopes without changing the job content (the imported documents).
Proceed as follows to unbundle a job.

step.para: Switch to the Jobs view.
Select at least one job from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Unbundle jobs
(Unbundle jobs).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Unbundle Jobs opens. The confirmation dialog contains the ID of the selected job (or jobs).

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Unbundle Jobs, click OK to unbundle the selected job and return it to state IMPORT.
In the confirmation dialog Unbundle Jobs, click Cancel to close the dialog without unbundling the selected job

sect1.title: Reimporting a Job
sect1.para: Using this action you can reimport (set to state IMPORT) one or more jobs. This will reimport all documents contained in the CSV file of the job. The result may be a modified (larger or smaller) job that may need to be preprocessed (split or merged) again.
Proceed as follows to reimport a selected job for processing.

step.para: Switch to the Jobs view.
Select at least one job from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Reimport
(Reimport).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Reimport Jobs opens. The confirmation dialog contains the ID of the selected job (or jobs).

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Reimport Jobs, click OK to reimport the documents for the selected job and return the job to state IMPORT.
In the confirmation dialog Reimport Jobs, click Cancel to close the dialog without reimporting the selected job.

sect1.title: Splitting One Job Into Multiple Jobs
sect1.para: Use this action to split an existing job into multiple new jobs.
Proceed as follows to split a selected job into several individual jobs.

note.para:
Please note that splitting a job into multiple jobs is only supported for a single job. If you have selected multiple jobs in the overview table of the Jobs view, the button Button Split
(Split) in the navigation bar of the view is disabled.

step.para: Switch to the Jobs view.
Select a job from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Merge
(Split).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Split Job opens. The confirmation dialog contains the ID of the selected job.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Split Job, click OK to split the selected job into several new jobs.
In the confirmation dialog Split Job, click Cancel to close the dialog without splitting the selected job.

sect1.title: Merging Multiple Jobs Into One Job
sect1.para: Use this action to merge several existing jobs into a single new job.
Proceed as follows to merge several selected jobs into one job.

step.para: Switch to Jobs view.
Select a job from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Merge
(Merge).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Merge Jobs opens. The confirmation dialog contains the ID of the selected job (or jobs).

step.para: In the Merge Jobs confirmation dialog, click OK to merge the selected jobs into a new job.
In the confirmation dialog Merge Jobs, click Cancel to close the dialog without merging the selected jobs into a new job.

sect1.title: Delaying Job Processing
sect1.para: Using this action you can delay processing of a job by the specified number of days, hours and/or minutes. This action is useful, for example, if you know that a required resource is not yet available. Delayed processing allows you to avoid error messages.
Proceed as follows to start job processing with a delay.

step.para: Switch to the Jobs view.
Select (at least) one job from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button retain
(Retain).

result.para: The Retain dialog opens. The dialog contains an input field where you can specify until when (date and time) you want to retain the selected job.

step.para: Click the calendar in the Retained Until field to open the date and time selection in a separate dialog.
In the date and time selection dialog, select the day and, if necessary, the time until which you want to retain the selected job.
Click Reset in the date and time selection dialog, to close the dialog without selecting a point in time (date and time) to which you want to retain the selected job.
click Done in the date and time selection dialog, to confirm the date and time selection and close the dialog.

result.para: The date and time selection dialog closes.If you have selected a date and time, the date and time are copied to the Retained Until field in the Retain job dialog.

step.para: In the Retain job dialog, click OK to delay processing of the selected job until the specified day and time and to close the Retain job dialog.
Click Cancel in the Retain dialog to close the Retain dialog without delaying processing of the selected job.

sect1.title: Deleting Jobs
sect1.para: Use this action to delete a single job or multiple jobs. Proceed as follows to delete existing jobs:

step.para: Switch to Jobs view.
Select at least one job from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Delete
(Delete).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Delete Jobs opens.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Delete Jobs, click OK to delete the selected job (or jobs).
In the confirmation dialog Delete Jobs, click Cancel to close the dialog without deleting the selected job(s).

result.para: If the job(s) has (have) been successfully deleted, a success message is displayed in a separate dialog.
If the job(s) could not be deleted, the corresponding error message is displayed in a separate dialog.
